column1: 7/26/24 Starting from Mt. Katahdin!
8/2/24 Just finished the 100 mile wilderness! After being wet for a week straight I am taking a 0 at Shaws
8/6/24 After completing Moxie Bald Mountain I took the ferry over the Kennebec river!
8/16/24 Today we climbed the saddleback mountains. Overall it was a very enjoyable climb with a few rock scrambles
8/19/24 Today I hiked up to the summit of Baldpate Mountain. There was little to no visibility and the conditions were windy and cold. Nonetheless it was an amazing time!
8/22/24 Today we had to stop early after only hiking 4 miles due to inclement weather. Tomorrow we will move on to Mahoosuc Notch!
8/23/24 We completed the Mahoosuc Notch in 1 hr and 59 minutes and 44 seconds!
8/24/24 Made it out of Maine! Overall the state was beautiful but I’m eager to keep moving on to the white mountains!
8/26/24 Today we completed the Wildcat Mountains
column2: which is the first mountain range in the White Mountains! I had beautiful weather and a smooth ride to start the most technical part of my journey.

column1: 8/28/24 Finished Mt. Madison today! After enjoying a coffee and a bowl of soup at the Madison Spring Hut
column2: I am going to stealth camp and hit the rest of the range tomorrow!

column1: 8/29/24 Today I finished the Presidential Range of the White Mountains and enjoyed beautiful weather the whole day!
8/30/24 I continued my way through the White Mountains and after pushing through day hikers all day long
column2: I finally completed Franconia Range leaving just 2 ranges left for the Whites!

column1: 8/31/24 Today I slacked packed through the Kingsman Range of the White mountains with beautiful weather and even better views
9/1/24 Today I finished the White Mountains by climbing Mt. Moosilauke!
9/15/24 Today I left Little Rock Pond and made it to the Bromley shelter
9/21/24 After seeing the beautiful view from Mt. Greylock I hiked into the town of Dalton where I spent the evening camping at Levardi’s and am taking a bus to do a quick visit home!
9/24/24 Today I started out alone and began the journey to catch up to my tramily. I spent the night at Full Goose Pond cabin
column2: where I slept in a bunk and ate a pancake breakfast!

column1: 9/27/24 I reached the 700 mile marker where I stopped at the Mountain Side Cafe for a coffee and a burger.
9/29/24 Stopped for a quick resupply at Bulls Bridge Market.
10/1/24 I spent the night at Canopus Lake Beach Shelter. Unfortunately everything was closed this late in the season.
10/3/24 Today I crossed the Hudson River and climbed Bear Mountain where I saw the trailside zoo and spent the night at West Mountain Shelter over looking NYC!
10/6/24 Resupplied in Green Wood Lake where I got a sub from the Country Grocery.
10/8/24 I stayed at the Highpoint Shelter where I met a section hiker named Gobbler and spent the evening trying to stay warm in the shelter.
10/11/24 Crossed the Beaver Pond outlet where I saw lots of wild life and took in the view of the water.
10/15/24 Today I crossed the Delaware River into PA and met up with another thru hiker named Bones.
10/18/24 We stayed at the Breezy Acres Hostel with Mary Poppins who treated us very well
column3: and dropped us off at the trail head! I highly recommend stopping by.

column1: 10/20/24 I arrived at the Lookout Hostel
column2: where I finally caught up to Sherpa and the tramily for a wonderful reunion.

column1: 10/22/24 I passed through Port Clinton as we make our way through PA. There are a lot more hunters on the trail than I had imagined.
10/25/24 I stayed at the 501 shelter after completing 1
10/27/24 I crossed the Susquehanna River and enjoyed a sunrise as I crossed the bridge.
10/29/24 I stopped at the Green Mountain General Store for the half gallon challenge
column2: which is definitely a challenge for the summer since we were freezing. I completed it in 40 mins.

column1: 10/31/24 I crossed the state line into MD which is my home state! It was also interesting seeing the smoldering remains for the recent wild fire.
11/2/24 We crossed into Harpers Ferry where we stayed with the Yellow Deli for 2 night...it was an interesting experience.
11/4/24 Sherpa and I stayed at the Black Burn trail center where we had a wood stove to keep us warm and fresh fruit we had packed out.
11/6/24 We finished the roller coaster in one day! We were very sore and tired after we got in late at night
column2: but it was a fun challenge!

column1: 11/8/24 Today we started the 100 mile journey through the Shenandoah Mountains and saw a bear!
11/13/24 We finished the Shenandoah Mountain range today
column2: which were some of the best views we had seen since the White Mountains.

column1: 11/15/24 Today Sherpa and I climbed the Priest going SOBO where it was a 3
column3: which is very fun...and the confessional was a very entertaining read.

column1: 11/21/24 After all of that
column2: we wrapped up the 2024 season by heading into Glasgow to stay at Stanimals hostel. It's incredibly bitter sweet and I am devistated that I didn't get to finish this year due to the hurricance
column3: but that just means I get to do it all again! Peace and Love -Heisenberg
